questions.text: At what age do current guidelines for osteoporosis prevention recommend initiation of screening with this modality for women at average risk?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ BMD testing is recommended for all menopausal women who: > 65 years ≥ risk factor for osteoporosis h/o fracture
  • ➤ BMD testing is recommended for all menopausal women who: > 65 years ≥ risk factor for osteoporosis h/o fracture
  • ➤ recommended for all menopausal women who:
  • ➤ > 65 years ≥ risk factor for osteoporosis h/o fracture
  • ➤ > 65 years
  • ➤ ≥ risk factor for osteoporosis
  • ➤ h/o fracture
  • ➤ Ref: Page 481, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 481, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition

questions.text: Sonographic features of adenomyosis, include all EXCEPT which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Adenomyosis is best diagnosed by ultraound (TVS)
  • ➤ Adenomyosis is best diagnosed by ultraound (TVS)

questions.text: Uses of sonography in the evaluation and treatment of infertility include which of the following? a. Anti-sperm antibodies b. Monitoring of folliculogenesis in normal and stimulated cycles c. Demonstration and characterization of congenital uterine anomalies d. Ovarian reserve e. Tubal spasm f. Endometrial cavity evaluation
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ I n Evaluation of Infertility, the initial investigations of choice include
  • ➤ I
  • ➤ n Evaluation of Infertility, the initial investigations of choice include
  • ➤ For male factor: Semen analysis For ovarian factor: History/ Follicular imaging/ serum progesterone level on Day 21 For tubal factor: HSG For uterine factor: Trans-vaginal sonography
  • ➤ For male factor: Semen analysis
  • ➤ For ovarian factor: History/ Follicular imaging/ serum progesterone level on Day 21
  • ➤ For tubal factor: HSG
  • ➤ For uterine factor: Trans-vaginal sonography
  • ➤ Ref: Page 31, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 31, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a contraindication to doing an HSG?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A Hysterosalpingography (HSG) is an investigation used in initial evaluation of tubal patency in infertile women. It also helps assess the uterine cavity and Mullerian anomalies.
  • ➤ A Hysterosalpingography (HSG) is an investigation used in initial evaluation of tubal patency in infertile women. It also helps assess the uterine cavity and Mullerian anomalies.
  • ➤ Ref: Page 39, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 39, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: Uses of magnetic resonance (MR) imaging in gynecology include all EXCEPT?

options.label: B
options.text: Initial evaluation of suspected gynecologic disease

options.label: C
options.text: Detailed characterization of congenital mullerian anomalies

options.label: D
options.text: Evaluation of endometrial lesions when sonography is nondiagnostic in a patient who is a poor surgical candidate

questions.correct_answer: B. Initial evaluation of suspected gynecologic disease
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Gynecological pathology, an ultraosund is usually the prliminary imaging modality An MRI however gives additional information especially in distorted pelvic anatomy, endometriosis, large masses, suspected malignancies and Mullerian anomalies
  • ➤ In Gynecological pathology, an ultraosund is usually the prliminary imaging modality
  • ➤ In Gynecological pathology, an ultraosund is usually the prliminary imaging modality
  • ➤ An MRI however gives additional information especially in distorted pelvic anatomy, endometriosis, large masses, suspected malignancies and Mullerian anomalies
  • ➤ An MRI however gives additional information especially in distorted pelvic anatomy, endometriosis, large masses, suspected malignancies and Mullerian anomalies
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gyn 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gyn 3 rd edition

questions.text: Of Mullerian defects, which has the lowest associated risk of recurrent miscarriage and is shown here in this three-dimensional sonographic image?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Best reproductive performance amongst Mullerian anomalies: Arcuate uterus (f/b uterine didelphys) Poorest reprodutive performance: Septate uterus and Unicornuate uterus
  • ➤ Best reproductive performance amongst Mullerian anomalies: Arcuate uterus (f/b uterine didelphys)
  • ➤ Poorest reprodutive performance: Septate uterus and Unicornuate uterus
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: What is the primary advantage of saline infusion sonography compared with transvaginal sonography?

options.label: C
options.text: Ability to perform at any time of the cycle

options.label: D
options.text: Simultaneous assessment of myometrium and endometrium

questions.correct_answer: B. Superior detection of intracavitary masses
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A saline infusion sonography (SIS) is superior to a TVS for visualization of the endometrial cavity and in delineating submucosal fibroids and endometrial polyps An HSG is better than SIS for determining tubal patency
  • ➤ A saline infusion sonography (SIS) is superior to a TVS for visualization of the endometrial cavity and in delineating submucosal fibroids and endometrial polyps
  • ➤ An HSG is better than SIS for determining tubal patency
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 42, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition

questions.text: Characteristics of the soft, fleshy intrauterine growth, shown here exhibiting a single feeder vessel, include which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The main diagnostic tool is a Pap smear

options.label: B
options.text: It is a rare cause of abnormal uterine bleeding

options.label: C
options.text: Infertility has been linked directly with this growth

options.label: D
options.text: Use of oral contraceptive pills appears to be protective

questions.correct_answer: D. Use of oral contraceptive pills appears to be protective
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oral contraceptive pills are protective for Endometrial polyps Endometrial cancer Ovarian cancer Colo-rectal cancer
  • ➤ Oral contraceptive pills are protective for Endometrial polyps Endometrial cancer Ovarian cancer Colo-rectal cancer
  • ➤ Oral contraceptive pills are protective for
  • ➤ Endometrial polyps Endometrial cancer Ovarian cancer Colo-rectal cancer
  • ➤ Endometrial polyps
  • ➤ Endometrial cancer
  • ➤ Ovarian cancer
  • ➤ Colo-rectal cancer
  • ➤ Ref: Page 188, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 188, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: A 44-year-old patient presents with complaints of menorrhagia which has been increasing. She has no other medical problems. 3D USG reveals the findings as shown below. All EXCEPT which of the following are choices for medical treatment in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mirena (LNG-IUS), is contra-indicated when there is significant distortion of the endometrial cavity which is seen in a submucosal fibroid; hence an LNG-IUS should not be given to this woman
  • ➤ Ref: 208, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: 208, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition

questions.text: Your patient presents with acute lower abdominal pain, 8 weeks of amenorrhea, and vaginal spotting. She has a history of gonorrhea, and her pregnancy test result is positive. A transvaginal sonographic sagittal view of her uterus and cul-de-sac is shown here. These findings are most suggestive of which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ USG features of ectopic pregnancy
  • ➤ USG features of ectopic pregnancy
  • ➤ 1. Ruptured: Hemoperitoneum with an adnexal mass
  • ➤ 2. Unruptured:
  • ➤ A gestational sac with yolk sac and/or fetal pole seen in the adnexal region Bagel sign Blob sign Ring f fire sign (On doppler) Pseudo sac intra-uterine
  • ➤ A gestational sac with yolk sac and/or fetal pole seen in the adnexal region
  • ➤ Bagel sign
  • ➤ Blob sign
  • ➤ Ring f fire sign (On doppler)
  • ➤ Pseudo sac intra-uterine
  • ➤ Ref: Page 218, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 218, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: A 29-year-old female with irregular cycles presents for evaluation. A sonogram of her ovaries reveals the following findings. The ovarian follicles seen are which type
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sonographic criteria or polycystic ovaries from the 2003 Rotterdam conference include ≥ 12 small antral follicles (2 to 9 mm in diameter) or an increased ovarian volume (> 10 mL) or both Only one ovary with these findings is sufficient to define PCOS
  • ➤ Sonographic criteria or polycystic ovaries from the 2003 Rotterdam conference include ≥ 12 small antral follicles (2 to 9 mm in diameter) or an increased ovarian volume (> 10 mL) or both
  • ➤ Only one ovary with these findings is sufficient to define PCOS
  • ➤ Ref: Page 397, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 397, Williams Gynecology, 3 rd edition
